key_title: Key to the genera of Arecaceae

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Monocotyledons

source.author: Conn, B.J.; Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Arecaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Conn, B.J.; Walsh, N.G. (1994). Arecaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves pinnate, the basal-most pinnae modified as spines; fruit a yellow or reddish berry
Leaves palmate; fruit a black, purlish- or blue-black drupe
Dead leaves persisting only briefly, falling away leaving only annular scars; filaments connate to form a fleshy ring
Dead leaves persisting as a skirt and at least upper trunk covered with persistent petiole bases but may be concealed by skirt; filaments not connate

Petiole margins with very fine teeth; leaf segments without curling whitish threads; inflorescences yellow, remaining within leaf crown; carpels completely free, with 3 separate styles; seeds reniform

Petiole margins with broad curved teeth; leaf segments with curling whitish threads at margins; inflorescences whitish, extending beyond the leaf crown; carpels connate distally to form a common style; seeds ellipsoid
